result.execSummary:
The defendant Ramon Diaz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: With Huber release privileges for work, school, and treatment, concurrent to count 2 and to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days served.
Defendant must sign up for probation by 09/16/2022.

miscConds.notes:
- All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid during the period of probation. If revoked, to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
- Any cash bail on deposit to apply if applicable.
- Restitution set at $0.00.
- Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.

- No contact with firearms.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
- Defendant IS EILIGIBLE for expungement as to counts 1 and 2.

- Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
- No new law violations.

- Cooperate with agent.
- Provide DNA Sample by 09/16/2022.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes: As to Count 1: Serve 45 days in HOC as Condition Time, STAYED pending use at agent's discretion.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: With Huber release privileges for work, school, and treatment, concurrent to count 1 and to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ramon Diaz

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ramon Diaz in court.  Attorney Annette E Rauch in court for Ramon Diaz.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.

Amended Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

As to Counts 1 and 2: Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint/ Information as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification Statements by parties. 

As to Count 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, with Huber release privileges for work, school, and treatment, concurrent to count 2 and to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days served. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 1 year.

As to Count 2: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 3 months in the House of Correction, with Huber release privileges for work, school, and treatment, concurrent to count 1 and to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days served. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 1 year.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
- Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.
- No new law violations. 
- Cooperate with agent. 
- 50 hours of community service at a non- profit organization.
- As to Count 1: Serve 45 days in HOC as Condition Time, STAYED pending use at agent's discretion.
- Restitution set at $0.00.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide DNA Sample by 09/16/2022.
- All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid during the period of probation. If revoked, to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
- Any cash bail on deposit to apply if applicable.
- Defendant must sign up for probation by 09/16/2022.
- Defendant IS EILIGIBLE for expungement as to counts 1 and 2.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Received and Filed. Addendum to Plea Questionnaire
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights

Defendant Ramon Diaz in court with attorney Annette E Rauch.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Case calendared for Plea and Sentencing this date.  Defense requests adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Ramon Diaz in court with attorney Annette E Rauch.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Discussion with parties. Defense counsel advises that parties are now in a resolution posture, and requests a Plea/Sentencing date. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Ramon Diaz in court with attorney Annette E Rauch.  John J Rejowski appeared on behalf of Patrick Franken for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Discussions with parties. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the state. Case adjourned for a Status Conference to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Stark.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grayson, Br. 16.

Defendant Ramon Diaz in court with Attorney Annette E Rauch; both appear by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Request for Substitution of Judge

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant Ramon Diaz in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Ramon Diaz in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT REFUSED TO BE INTERVIEWED WILL BE HIRING PRIVATE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
